intro: Charpentiera tomentosa var. maakuaensis, commonly known as the Maakuaena tree, is a rare endemic species native to Hawaii. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are thick and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in humid environments. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features and is of significant ecological importance in its native range.
